alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...KING WILLIAM AND SOUTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Studley, or near Mechanicsville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Manquin around 755 PM EDT. Aylett around 805 PM EDT. Saint Stephens Church around 815 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beazley, Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Walkerton, Epworth, Westwood, and Biscoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
